Sentence.sentence: Panini's Ancient Rome and Modern Rome represent the sights most prized, including celebrated Greco-Roman statues and views of famous ruins, fountains, and churches.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: On a glacier-filled island with fjords ( ' , 峡湾) and elephant seals, Russia has built Antarctica's first Orthodox church on a hill overlooking its research base.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Bearded Russian priests offer regular services at the Orthodox church for the 16 or so Russian speakers who spend the winter at the base, largely polar scientists in fields like glaciology and meteorology.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: At least three Russian stations are already operating in Antarctica, part of its effort to challenge the dominance of the American GPS, and new stations are planned for sites like the Russian base, in the shadow of the Orthodox Church of the Holy Trinity.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: At first their church helped out, but you can't keep that up forever," Andrea says.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: On a glacier-filled island with fjords and elephant seals, Russia has built Antarctica's first Orthodox church on a hill overlooking its research base.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The complex style of the medieval wooden church carvings and the skills used to make them almost certainly to derive from the ancient Viking tradition.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The earliest free-standing wooden church was probably built in Norway in around 1080.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The Wallaces, both children of church ministers, had a clearly defined formula for their "little magazine", as Reader's digest was originally subtitled.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均可表示"教堂"之意。
means: church ： 普通用词，指顶礼膜拜上帝之地，也是西方人举行婚、丧等活动的场所。
cathedral ： 指一个教区内最大的教堂，即主教堂或总教堂，通常是装饰精良，宏伟肃穆。

Sentence.sentence: Look over the "city of dreaming spires" from St Mary's church tower.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Some were political in nature, criticizing the church and government.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: The family rented a former church in downtown portland and scheduled a concert.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Then we crossed paths at a church fund-raiser.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: To take this approach to the New Englanders normally mean to start with the Puritans’ theological innovations and their distinctive ideas about the church-important subjects that we may not neglect.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Besides the ninety or so learned ministers who came to Massachusetts church in the decade after 1629,There were political leaders like John Winthrop, an educated gentleman, lawyer, and official of the Crown before he journeyed to Boston.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Besides the ninety or so learned ministers who came to Massachusetts church in the decade after 1629, there were political leaders like John Winthrop, an educated gentleman, lawyer, and official of the Crown before he journeyed to Boston.
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Despite attempts by the Church to strong-arm this new generation of logicians and rationalists, more explanations for how the universe functioned were being made, and at a rate that the people-including the Church -could no longer ignore.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Galileo was excommunicated by the Church and imprisoned for life for his astronomical observations and his support of the heliocentric principle.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: It turned from God and the authority of the Roman Catholic Church and instead favoured a more humanistic approach to being.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Scientific method, reductionism and the questioning of Church ideals was to be encouraged, as were ideas of liberty, tolerance and progress.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: To take this approach to the New Englanders normally means to start with the Puritans' theological innovations and their distinctive ideas about the church -- important subjects that we may not neglect.
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: There are three churches in this town.
sentences.cn: 这座城里有三个教堂。

sentences.en: Church begins at nine o'clock.
sentences.cn: 礼拜仪式九点开始。

sentences.en: He was the pillar of the church.
sentences.cn: 他是那个教会的中坚。

means.word_mean: 基督教牧师；基督教机构</seg>

entry.def: A church is a building in which Christians worship. You usually refer to this place as church when you are talking about the time that people spend there.

example.tran: 英国最古老的教堂之一

entry.def: A Church is one of the groups of people within the Christian religion, for example Catholics or Methodists, that have their own beliefs, clergy, and forms of worship.

example.ex: Church leaders said he was welcome to return.
example.tran: 教会领袖说欢迎他回来。

entry.def: You can refer to an organization, group, or area of activity as a broad church when it includes a wide range of opinions, beliefs, or styles.
entry.tran: 广纳众议的机构（或团体）；兼收并蓄的活动

example.ex: The party has responded by trying to become a broad church that appeals to devout pensioners, Munich punks and aerospace engineers...
example.tran: 该党的反应是要努力成为一个吸引笃信宗教的退休者、慕尼黑朋客族和航天工程师的兼收并蓄的政党。

example.ex: It rapidly became apparent that rock'n'roll was a very broad church indeed.
example.tran: 摇滚乐实际无所不包，这一点很快就显而易见了。

means.word_mean: 1. one of the groups of Christians who have their own beliefs and forms of worship
2. a place for public (especially Christian) worship;
3. a service conducted in a church;
4. the body of people who attend or belong to a particular local church;

sentences.sentence: "our church is hosting a picnic next week"

means.word_mean: 1. perform a special church rite or service for;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cir(i)ce, cyr(i)ce, related to Dutch kerk and German Kirche, based on medieval Greek kurikon, from Greek kuriakon (dōma) 'Lord's (house'), from kurios 'master or lord'. Compare with kirk

sentences.cn: 1629年之后的十年间，大约有九十名知识渊博的牧师来到了马萨诸塞州的教会。除此以外，还有诸如约翰·温斯罗普这样的政治领袖。温斯罗普是一位受过良好教育的绅士，在来波士顿之前曾担任过律师和王室官员。
sentences.en: Besides the ninety or so learned ministers who came to Massachusetts churches in the decade after 1629,there were political leaders like John Winthrop, an educated gentleman, lawyer, and official of the Crown before he journeyed to Boston.
